statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: For this problem, you will write a program that reads in a sequence of 32-bit signed integers. After each odd-indexed value is read, output the median (middle value) of the elements received so far.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
The first line of input contains a single integer P, (1 �� P �� 1000), which is the number of data sets that follow. The first line of each data set contains the data set number, followed by a space, followed by an odd decimal integer M, (1 �� M �� 9999), giving the total number of signed integers to be processed.
The remaining line(s) in the dataset consists of the values, 10 per line, separated by a single space.
The last line in the dataset may contain less than 10 values.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each data set the first line of output contains the data set number, a single space and the number of medians output (which should be one-half the number of input values plus one). The output medians will be on the following lines, 10 per line separated by a single space. The last line may have less than 10 elements, but at least 1 element. There should be no blank lines in the output.
